head.supplied: There is something funny about this date. If M did not receive his free pass until 31 December, he could not by 2 January have been "2 days behind my time", and Tintaldra is c. 130 k east of Albury. B...

p.style: font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; margin-bottom: 0.0416in; margin-left: -0.8861in; text-indent: 0.8861in; color: #C00000; hyphenate: false; break-before: page;

div.p:
To proof.
There is something funny about this date. If M did not receive his free pass until 31 December, he could not by 2 January have been "2 days behind my time", and Tintaldra is c. 130 k east of Albury. Being driven down to Albury makes me suspect that this was near the end of his excursion and that there is a digit missing after 2 in the day date.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; margin-bottom: 0.0416in; margin-left: -0.8861in; text-indent: 0.8861in; color: #C00000; hyphenate: false;
font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; margin-bottom: 0.0416in; margin-left: -0.8861in; text-indent: 0.8861in; color: #C00000; hyphenate: false;

div.p: Letters dated 1 January to George Bentham, Joseph Hooker (-01a), Asa Gray (-01b), Fenzl (-01c). On the face of it M was also in Melbourne when he wrote 74-01-06 to Odgers.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; margin-bottom: 0.0416in; margin-left: -0.8861in; text-indent: 0.8861in; color: #C00000; hyphenate: false;

div.p: Sent me on a deeper trawl, and found that the date MUST be wrong:

p.style: font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; margin-bottom: 0.0416in; margin-left: -0.8861in; text-indent: 0.8861in; color: #C00000; hyphenate: false;

div.p: In his report 74-08-00 M wrote of this trip "Cursorily as this first journey necessarily was, which occupied my time from the 6th to the 26th January"

Tintaldra
Tintaldra Station, upper Murray River, Vic.

It is with much regret, dear Mr Gray, that I miss the pleasure of saluting you at your friendly home this time. I am two days behind my time already, through the rain and flood, experienced in the alpine ranges.
M applied for a free railway pass to Albury in M to J. Francis, 24 December 1873 (in this editionas73-12-24a), and received it on 31 December.He did not leave Melbourne until 6 January 1874 (M to R. Ramsay, August 1874(in this edition as 74-08-00)).For accounts of the botany, see M to G. Bentham, 27 January 1874.
I now learn here that Mr Watson
Of Tintaldra Station.
proceeds to morrow to Albury, and that thus I shall have a fair opportunity to enjoy a drive with that Gentleman down the river. As Mr Findlay
Of Towong Station.
most kindly intends to drive me down to Mr Watson's principle residence, I must reserve the pleasure of calling on you, until I again visit this beautiful and healthy district
Thanking you for your very friendly and obliging attention and trusting to see you some day in Melbourne, I remain your very regardful
